Email.description: Email of the owner of this phone number that is being hosted.

CcEmails.description: Optional. A list of emails that LOA document for this HostedNumberOrder will be carbon copied to.

Status.description: User can only post to `pending-verification` status to transition the HostedNumberOrder to initiate a verification call or verification of ownership with a copy of a phone bill.

VerificationCode.description: A verification code that is given to the user via a phone call to the phone number that is being hosted.

VerificationType.description: Optional. The method used for verifying ownership of the number to be hosted. One of phone-call (default) or phone-bill.

VerificationDocumentSid.description: Optional. The unique sid identifier of the Identity Document that represents the document for verifying ownership of the number to be hosted. Required when VerificationType is phone-bill.

Extension.description: Digits to dial after connecting the verification call.

CallDelay.description: The number of seconds, between 0 and 60, to delay before initiating the verification call. Defaults to 0.

SmsCapability.description: Used to specify that the SMS capability will be hosted on Twilio's platform.

AccountSid.description: This defaults to the AccountSid of the authorization the user is using. This can be provided to specify a subaccount to add the HostedNumberOrder to.

FriendlyName.description: A 64 character string that is a human readable text that describes this resource.

UniqueName.description: Optional. Provides a unique and addressable name to be assigned to this HostedNumberOrder, assigned by the developer, to be optionally used in addition to SID.

CcEmails.description: Optional. A list of emails that the LOA document for this HostedNumberOrder will be carbon copied to.

SmsUrl.description: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the phone number. This will be copied onto the IncomingPhoneNumber resource.

SmsMethod.description: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either `GET` or `POST`.  This will be copied onto the IncomingPhoneNumber resource.

SmsFallbackUrl.description: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl. This will be copied onto the IncomingPhoneNumber resource.

SmsFallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Must be either `GET` or `POST`. This will be copied onto the IncomingPhoneNumber resource.

StatusCallbackUrl.description: Optional. The Status Callback URL attached to the IncomingPhoneNumber resource.

StatusCallbackMethod.description: Optional. The Status Callback Method attached to the IncomingPhoneNumber resource.

SmsApplicationSid.description: Optional. The 34 character sid of the application Twilio should use to handle SMS messages sent to this number. If a `SmsApplicationSid` is present, Twilio will ignore all of the SMS urls above and use those set on the application.

AddressSid.description: Optional. A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the Address resource that represents the address of the owner of this phone number.

Email.description: Optional. Email of the owner of this phone number that is being hosted.

VerificationType.description: Optional. The method used for verifying ownership of the number to be hosted. One of phone-call (default) or phone-bill.

VerificationDocumentSid.description: Optional. The unique sid identifier of the Identity Document that represents the document for verifying ownership of the number to be hosted. Required when VerificationType is phone-bill.

Configurations.FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.

Configurations.Voice.Url.description: The URL Twilio we should call using the `voice.method` when the phone number receives a call. The `voice.url` is ignored if a `voice.application_sid` or a `trunk_sid` is set.

Configurations.Voice.Method.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice.url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

Configurations.Voice.FallbackUrl.description: The URL that we should call if an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML requested by `voice.url`.

Configurations.Voice.FallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice.fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

Configurations.Voice.ApplicationSid.description: The SID of the application we should use to handle phone calls to the phone number. If a `voice.application_sid` is present, we ignore all of the voice urls and use those of the application. Setting a `voice.application_sid`  automatically deletes your `trunk_sid` and vice versa.

Configurations.Sms.Url.description: The URL we should call using the `sms.method` when the phone number receives an incoming SMS message.

Configurations.Sms.Method.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `sms.url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

Configurations.Sms.FallbackUrl.description: The URL that we should call using the `sms.fallback_method` if an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML returned by the `sms.url`.

Configurations.Sms.FallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `sms.fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

Configurations.Sms.ApplicationSid.description: The SID of the application we should use to handle SMS messages sent to the number. If an `sms.application_sid` is present, we ignore the SMS URLs and use those of the application.

Configurations.StatusCallback.description: The URL that we should call using the `status_callback_method` to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

Configurations.StatusCallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `status_callback`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

PhoneNumber.description: The phone number in [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) format, which consists of a + followed by the country code and subscriber number.

Configurations.FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.

Configurations.Voice.Url.description: The URL Twilio we should call using the `voice.method` when the phone number receives a call. The `voice.url` is ignored if a `voice.application_sid` or a `trunk_sid` is set.

Configurations.Voice.Method.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice.url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

Configurations.Voice.FallbackUrl.description: The URL that we should call if an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML requested by `voice.url`.

Configurations.Voice.FallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice.fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

Configurations.Voice.ApplicationSid.description: The SID of the application we should use to handle phone calls to the phone number. If a `voice.application_sid` is present, we ignore all of the voice urls and use those of the application. Setting a `voice.application_sid`  automatically deletes your `trunk_sid` and vice versa.

Configurations.Sms.Url.description: The URL we should call using the `sms.method` when the phone number receives an incoming SMS message.

Configurations.Sms.Method.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `sms.url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

Configurations.Sms.FallbackUrl.description: The URL that we should call using the `sms.fallback_method` if an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML returned by the `sms.url`.

Configurations.Sms.FallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `sms.fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

Configurations.Sms.ApplicationSid.description: The SID of the application we should use to handle SMS messages sent to the number. If an `sms.application_sid` is present, we ignore the SMS URLs and use those of the application.

Configurations.StatusCallback.description: The URL that we should call using the `status_callback_method` to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

Configurations.StatusCallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `status_callback`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.
